For the extrusion: Extrude Face 1 by 0.2 towards the normal direction, and Face 2 by 0.0 in the opposite direction of normals. Note that the measurements given may have minor variations due to formatting constraints, and therefore the junior CAD designer should make necessary adjustments for precision and accuracy when generating the final CAD models.</description>

The curved side has a radius of 0.5 units. 1. **Create a new coordinate system** with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.45, 0.0] 2. **Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane** of the new coordinate system. 3. **Create a rectangle** by drawing lines from the following points: - Line 1: (0.0, 0.0) to (0.15, 0.0) - Line 2: (0.15, 0.0) to (0.45, 0.0) - Line 3: (0.45, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0) - Line 4: (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.15) - Line 5: (0.75, 0.15) to (0.45, 0.15) - Line 6: (0.45, 0.15) to (0.45, 0.0744) - Line 7: (0.45, 0.0744) to (0.15, 0.0744) - Line 8: (0.15, 0.0744) to (0.15, 0.15) - Line 9: (0.15, 0.15) to (0.0, 0.15) - Line 10: (0.0, 0.15) to (0.0, 0.0) 4. **Close the loop** by connecting the last point to the first point. 5. **Create a curve** with a radius of 0.5 units on the arc between points (0.45, 0.0) and (0.15, 0.0). 6. **Scale the 2D sketch** by a factor of 0.75. 7. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch** using the euler angles and translation vector of the coordinate system. 8. **Extrude the 2D sketch** along the Z-axis to generate the 3D model with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.45 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.75 - Operation: Create a new solid body. The resulting part will have the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.45 - Height: 0.75</description>
